intro: Cocculus pendulus, commonly known as the climbing nightshade, is a vine native to tropical and subtropical regions. It features heart-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant is notable for its distinctive, warty, green berries that turn red when mature. Cocculus pendulus is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and unique fruit. It is important to note that all parts of the plant contain toxic compounds and should be handled with care.
